meanings.definition: Study again in order to improve one's knowledge or understanding.
meanings.sent1: After the test, I will be restudying the chapters to do better next time.
meanings.sent2: I always find restudying helpful before exams to make sure I remember everything.
meanings.sent3: Restudying the same material can feel like going on a treasure hunt for new knowledge.
meanings.sent4: Restudying is like polishing a gem, each time revealing more brilliance and clarity.
meanings.sent5: The act of restudying can turn confusion into clarity, like a light shining in a dark room.

meanings.definition: To review material previously studied in order to refresh one's memory.
meanings.sent1: She spent the evening restudying her notes from the lecture.
meanings.sent2: Restudying old textbooks can help jog your memory before a big test.
meanings.sent3: Restudying can sometimes feel like flipping through an old photo album of memories.
meanings.sent4: Restudying is like revisiting an old friend, each time rediscovering something new.
meanings.sent5: The process of restudying can make forgotten information resurface, like finding a lost treasure.
